greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binary XOR of proper divisors of n.
comment: An alternative definition (with A027751) would define a(1)=1. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 14 2013
However, this definition is more aligned with A001065 and A218403 where the initial term a(1) is also 0. - _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 08 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16383
formula: a(n) = A178910(n) XOR n, where XOR is the binary logical exclusive or operator.
mathematica: Array[BitXor @@ Most@ Divisors@ # &, 79] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 08 2017 *)
program: (PARI) A227320(n) = { my(s=0); fordiv(n,d,if(d<n,s = bitxor(s,d))); s; }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 08 2017
results.author: _Alex Ratushnyak_, Jul 06 2013
